synopsis: In this engaging episode of Pineapple Blot Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir, along with special guest Garrett, dive deep into the complexities of body image and the gym. They explore personal experiences, the impact of societal standards, and the importance of self-acceptance while sharing laughs and valuable insights along the way.
quotes: The horror is persistent, but so do we.
You have to be comfortable with who you are right now to be able to love the body you want to become.
Everyone is trying their best, so shouldn't we be supportive of each other?
If you want to make a change to your body, that should be encouraged, but don’t hyper-fixate on the minor things.
You should go to the gym because you enjoy it, not just to change the way you look.
The strongest people in the gym are usually the nicest and most humble.
Comparison is the thief of joy and progress.
If you’re going to the gym to improve your body image, you should also be going because it’s something you enjoy.
Drink more water; it can change your life.
If you’re not happy with who you are now, you’ll never be happy with who you become.
